There are many ways to get into Newberg. Coming from I-5 you can take mckay road pretty much all the way there with just one right turn onto the st. paul highway. You can enter from Wilsonville by taking Wilsonville rd. 99W will allow you to enter from McMinnville or from the other side, Sherwood. Or from hillsborro you can drive over the hills and right on to College st. in Newberg.
Getting around Newberg can be done by car, on foot, or any other method you prefer. Newberg is a fairly small town and very easy to find your way around.

Check out one of the very few remaining drive in theaters in the US at the 99W Drive In Theater. 
Highway 99W, W of Springbrook rd. Newberg, OR 97132
The theater holds a max of 275 cars with one giant screen, plays 2 movies a night on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday during April to September.
Only $7 per person with a minimum of $11 per vehicle to watch two movies in the comfort of your own vehicle. sound is through AM/FM

Don't forget to head down to Roger's Landing and hang out for a day on the Willamette River. 
Just head down River st. and it will lead you right to the water. The Willamette River is a very popular river for water skiing, wakeboarding, tubing, jet skiing, or just floating down river on your party boat. The river is never too populated during the weekdays but saturday and sunday are usually pretty crowded so just make sure you know your boater safety. There are many docks along the river and always friendly people to lend you a hand if you run out of gas.
